bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Frederick F. Russell, April 23, 1929

div1.p: Carter informs Russell that she expects to leave for Baltimore to continue work with Frost very soon.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Frederick F. Russell, April 23, 1929
div1.opener:
Book, Misel
Russell (Report
weekly)
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N.W.
Washington, D. C.
April 23, 1929.
Dear Doctor Russell:
div1.p:
A long distance telephone message from Mrs. Frost, received
day before yesterday, stated that Dr. Frost hoped to be able to re-
sume the final editing of Father's MS this week. I am therefore, in
nautical parlance, “standing by” to go over to Baltimore at any
moment and, in the interim, am working at home and at the Library of
Congress on the few remaining incomplete references. Cleared up one
yesterday, which sounds like a small day's work, but I had next to
no data and am glad to have finally placed it.

With very best remembrances and hoping much to soon be able
to report work with Dr. Frost,
div1.closer:
Most truly yours, (Signed) Laura A. Carter, Dr. Frederick F. Russell,
Director,
International Health Division
The Rockefeller Foundation,
61 Broadway,
New York, N. Y.
